taskbody.context: This topic describes how to create a route. You can also copy an existing one.

prereq.p:
The following components must exist in the Plant Applications database before you create a route:
A production line linked to a single virtual unit
Material defined for the production line
BOM formulation defined for the material
If these components do not exist, contact the Plant Applications administrator.

step.cmd: In the Route Management page, select .
step.stepresult: The Create Route window appears. The REVISION box is disabled and populated with the value 1 because this is the first draft of the route.

step.cmd: Provide values as specified in the following table.

row.entry: Enter a unique name for the route that does not exceed 100 characters.
Enter a description for the route that does not exceed 1000 characters.
Select a production line to which the route belongs. This box contains a list of production lines defined in Plant Applications Administrator. A value is required in this field.

Select the material that you want to use in the route. This box is enabled after you select a value in the PRODUCTION LINE box. It contains a list of materials defined for the production line in Plant Applications.

Select the BOM formulation that you want to use in the route. This box is enabled after you select a value in the MATERIAL box. It contains a list of BOM formulations configured for the material in Plant Applications.

taskbody.result: The route is created and is in the draft state. The Edit Route page appears, allowing you to create an operation.

postreq.xref: Add an operation to the route.
